page.title: 01Valley South of Ludlow
page.content: This is a section of the West side of a broad valley of River Teme which flows south. It is highest on High Vinnals, 360m and lowest at about 72m The valley bottom is closely followed by A49 trunk road and railway. Just off this road there is a small village with its church still in use.Ashford Bowdler. The village of Richard's Castle is somewhat elongated along two lanes and in the block there is a church in use, no shop, a primary school now closed anddd a second church, above, little use near two farms and some timbered cottages. Elsewhere amongst smallish fields with low hedges, are a few farms, cottages the occasional large house in its own grounds and some bungalows. A quarter of the area is forest and the farming is mainly sheep andd cattle
